name: Dumbbell Hip Thrust
setup: Sit on floor with upper back against a bench
Bench should hit just below shoulder blades
Place dumbbell across hips, hold with both hands
Feet flat, hip-width apart, knees bent ~90°
steps: Drive through heels and squeeze glutes to lift hips
Raise hips until torso is parallel to floor
Pause 1-2s at top with maximal glute contraction
Lower hips under control to just above floor
cues: Keep ribs down, avoid arching low back
mistakes: Hyperextending lower back instead of using glutes
Rising onto toes instead of staying on heels
Cutting range short (not reaching full hip extension)
Letting dumbbell roll or slide during movement
safety: If lower back feels it, focus on glute squeeze and avoid excessive arch. Use a pad or towel under the dumbbell if hips are uncomfortable.

prescriptionHints.notes: Primary glute builder. Prioritize full extension and squeeze over load.

joints.notes: Avoid hyperextension in lower back. Keep tension in glutes, not lumbar spine. Use padding if hips are uncomfortable.
